title: J&J Offers $4 Billion Opioid Litigation Settlement
text:
Johnson & Johnson has offered to pay about $4 billion to settle all lawsuits in the U.S. accusing the company of contributing to the opioid-addiction epidemic, according to people familiar with the matter.

If completed, the deal would resolve more than 2,000 lawsuits by state and local governments alleging that J&J’s marketing of pain drugs including Duragesic and Nucynta fueled the opioid crisis.
